modules.description: Provides functions to parse, compare, and serialize reason strings for ignored items. Works with string representations of exclusion criteria and boolean flags indicating suppression status. Used to filter test cases or log entries based on predefined suppression rules.

Provides functions to validate and deprecate specific configuration entries, including checking for deprecated keys and transforming invalid entries into error messages. Works with associative lists and string-based key-value pairs. Used to enforce schema constraints during configuration parsing and generate actionable feedback for users.

Provides functions to validate constant expressions in a compiler pipeline, including checking for invalid literals and unsupported operations. Works with abstract syntax tree nodes and type information. Used to catch erroneous constant values during early stages of code analysis.

Handles validation and analysis of string literals to detect potentially unsafe or malformed content. Processes strings with custom parsing rules and returns structured results indicating suspicious patterns. Used to flag invalid escape sequences and unexpected character combinations in user-provided input.

Provides functions to validate and process OCaml format attributes, including parsing, checking, and transforming attribute syntax. Works with strings representing OCaml code and the type t to encapsulate attribute metadata. Used to enforce consistent formatting rules in code generation tools and linters.

Enforces Jane Street coding standards by rewriting code to require [@@deprecated] attributes to include a "since MM-YYYY" date. Processes OCaml source files, modifying annotations and formatting as specified. Ensures consistency in deprecation notices and style compliance during compilation.

Combines utilities for parsing, validating, and transforming various input types including exclusion criteria, configuration entries, constant expressions, string literals, and OCaml attributes. Processes string representations, associative lists, AST nodes, and attribute metadata to enforce constraints, detect anomalies, and generate structured feedback. Supports tasks like filtering test cases, deprecating invalid config keys, catching erroneous constants, flagging unsafe strings, and standardizing attribute syntax. Examples include suppressing log entries, warning about deprecated settings, rejecting invalid literals, identifying malformed escapes, and normalizing code formatting.
